actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide that corporate tax benefits from stock option compensation expenses are allowed only to the extent such expenses are included in corporate accounts.
short_title: Ending Double Standards for Stock Options Act

summary.text: Ending Double Standards for Stock Options Act - Amends Internal Revenue Code provisions relating to property transferred in connection with the performance of services to limit the deduction allowed to an employer in connection with stock options, except for broad-based option programs. Amends provisions relating to the credit for increasing research activities to set forth a special rule regarding the definition of "wages" when stock options are involved.

titles.title: Ending Double Standards for Stock Options Act

A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide that corporate tax benefits from stock option compensation expenses are allowed only to the extent such expenses are included in corporate accounts.
